Class NCLAttributeAssessment<T extends NCLElement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Eb extends NCLBind,Er extends NCLRoleElement>

public class NCLAttributeAssessment<T extends NCLElement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Eb extends NCLBind,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
extends ParamElement<T>
implements NCLElement<T>, NCLRoleElement<Eb>

Class that represents a attribute assessment element. This element represents the attribute whose value will be compared.
This element defines the attributes:

  • role - connector interface point, used to identify this attribute assessment. This attribute is required.
  • eventType - type of the event used in the attribute assessment. This attribute is required.
  • key - key pressed by the user. This attribute is optional.
  • attributeType - type of the attribute. This attribute is optional.
  • offset - value added to the attribute value. This attribute is optional.

setRole

public void setRole(java.lang.String role)
             throws XMLException
Sets the connector interface point, used to identify this attribute assessment. This attribute is required and can not be set to null.
The role must be unique inside the connector.

Parameters:
role - string representing the role name.
Throws:
XMLException - if the role is null or empty.

setKey

public void setKey(java.lang.Object key)
            throws XMLException
Sets the key pressed by the user, in case a selection event is used. This attribute is optional. Set the key to null to erase a key already defined.
The key can be set as a parameter, in which case its value is defined by the link that uses the connector where this attribute assessment is.
In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Parameters:
key - element from the enumeration NCLKey, string or connector parameter representing the key pressed or null to erase a key already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if an error occur while creating the key value.

In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Returns:
element from the enumeration NCLKey, string or connector parameter representing the key pressed or null if the attribute is not defined.

public void setOffset(java.lang.Object offset)
               throws XMLException
Sets the value added to the attribute value. This attribute is optional. Set the offset to null to erase an offset already defined.
The offset can be set as a parameter, in which case its value is defined by the link that uses the connector where this attribute assessment is.
In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Parameters:
offset - string, integer or connector parameter representing the offset or null to erase an offset already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if an error occur while creating the offset value.
